title: Tummy Time
content: Lay a soft blanket on the floor. Place your baby on their stomach for 2-3 minutes, 2-3 times a day. Stay close and talk to them or place a toy to encourage head lifting.

title: Sing a Lullaby
content: Hold your baby and sing a gentle lullaby like 'Twinkle, Twinkle' in a soft voice, rocking them for 5-10 minutes.

title: Mirror Play
content: Use a baby-safe mirror and place it 8-12 inches from your baby’s face during tummy time or while holding them.

title: Gentle Leg Cycling
content: Lay your baby on their back and gently move their legs in a circular pedaling motion for 1-2 minutes.

title: High-Contrast Cards
content: Show black-and-white or bold-colored cards 8-12 inches from your baby’s face, switching between cards every 10-20 seconds.

title: Peek-a-Boo
content: Cover your face with hands or a cloth, then reveal it and say 'Peek-a-boo!' Repeat several times as your baby giggles.

title: Texture Exploration
content: Let your baby touch different safe textures like a scarf, rubber ball, and wooden spoon. Name each item as they explore.

title: Rattle Play
content: Shake a lightweight rattle to get your baby’s attention, then place it in their hand or let them reach for it.

title: Stacking Cups
content: Give your baby 3-5 plastic cups to stack or nest. Let them explore and knock them over for fun learning.

title: Baby Dance
content: Hold your baby and gently sway or bounce to soft music for 5-10 minutes to encourage rhythm and bonding.

title: Block Building
content: Sit with your child and stack soft or wooden blocks into towers. Let them knock them down and try building.

title: Ball Rolling
content: Roll a soft ball back and forth between you and your child. Great for motor skills and social fun.

title: Finger Painting
content: Let your child explore non-toxic finger paint on paper. Encourage them to smear colors and be creative.

title: Story Time
content: Read a short picture book with your child. Point to pictures and make fun animal sounds to keep them engaged.

title: Hide and Seek Toy
content: Hide a small toy under a blanket and ask your child to find it. Repeat a few times to build problem-solving.

title: Simon Says
content: Play 'Simon Says' with simple actions like clapping or touching your nose. Helps with listening and following instructions.

title: Obstacle Course
content: Create a mini course with cushions and tape. Let your child crawl, climb, and balance through it.

title: Sorting Shapes
content: Let your child sort different shaped or colored toys into bowls. Teaches matching, sorting, and motor skills.

title: Pretend Play Kitchen
content: Use a toy kitchen or safe utensils to pretend-cook with your child. Stir, pour, and 'taste' food together.

title: Singing Action Songs
content: Sing songs like 'Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes' and do the actions with your child. Repeat several times.
